cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.product

Class Content

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.product.Content
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Application, Ringtone, Wallpaper

    public abstract class Content
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class representing a content item that is included in the Mobile Application Store. Attributes here are common to all items in the store, regardless of type. All content items (regardless of type) have the following attributes:
    • must have an ID
    • must have a name
    • must have a description
    • must have an authorName
    • must have a rating; 0 to 5, where 5 is best
    • may have any number of unique categories
    • must have 1 or more Country objects where the content may be legally downloaded
    • must have 1 or more associated compatible Device objects
    • must have a price (unit is BitCoins)
    • must have 1 or more supported language codes
    • must have an imageURL where a picture of the content lives
    Certain specific types of content may have additional required attributes. Each Content item that lives in the Product catalog is a unique item. Content items may be added to the Product catalog and made publicly searchable; those use cases are supported by means of the IProductAPI.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    David Killeffer <rayden7@gmail.com>
    See Also:
    ProductAPI, ContentSearch, Application, Ringtone, Wallpaper

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object compare)
      Since Content objects may be added to collections, and also since the IProductAPI enforces that all content items be unique, this method provides a way to determine if another Content item is the same as the current one.
      java.util.Set<Country> getAllowedInCountries()
      Returns the list of Country where the content may be legally downloaded and used

      Returns the content author's name

      Returns the list of discrete categories that the content item belongs to.

      Returns a list of all the compatible Device that the content item is compatible with

      Returns the ContentType of the content item.

      Returns the content item description.

      Returns the unique content ID of the item.
      java.lang.String getImageURL()
      Returns a string URL to an image (screenshot, box art, etc.) of the content item.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the content item.
      float getPrice()
      Returns the current price of the content item, expressed in BitCoins
      int getRating()
      Returns the current content item rating.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedLanguages()
      Returns the list of supported languages by the content.
      int hashCode()
      Since Content objects may be added to collections, and also since the IProductAPI enforces that all content items be unique, this method provides a way to get the unique hash code for the current content item.

        public Content(java.lang.String id,
       java.lang.String name,
       java.lang.String description,
       java.lang.String authorName,
       int rating,

       java.util.Set<Device> devices,
       float price,
       java.util.Set<Country> allowedInCountries,
       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> supportedLanguages,
       java.lang.String imageURL,
       ContentType type)
        Class constructor.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique content ID
        name - the content item name
        description - content item description
        authorName - content author's name
        rating - the current rating of the content item
        categories - list of categories the content item belongs to
        devices - all the unique Device objects that the content item is compatible with
        price - price of the content in BitCoins
        allowedInCountries - list of Country objects where the content may be downloaded
        supportedLanguages - list of 5-character supported language codes
        imageURL - a string to a public URL image of the content
        type - the ContentType of the item

      • validateContent

        public static boolean validateContent(Content content)
        Public static method that checks that all required fields are set, and that all content item values are valid (e.g., ratings are 0 to 5, where 5 is best, item price should only allow positive numbers, etc.).
        Parameters:
        content - the item to be validated for correct properties
        Returns:
        true if all properties are valid, false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object compare)
        Since Content objects may be added to collections, and also since the IProductAPI enforces that all content items be unique, this method provides a way to determine if another Content item is the same as the current one. Uses the Apache Commons EqualsBuilder to determine if the two objects are indeed equal to each other.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        compare - the Content item to compare to the current object to test for equality
        Returns:
        true if the objects are the same, false otherwise
        See Also:
        http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27581/overriding-equals-and-hashcode-in-java, http://www.java-tutorial.ch/core-java-tutorial/equalsbuilder, http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/javadocs/api-2.6/org/apache/commons/lang/builder/EqualsBuilder.html

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Since Content objects may be added to collections, and also since the IProductAPI enforces that all content items be unique, this method provides a way to get the unique hash code for the current content item. Uses the Apache Commons HashCodeBuilder to generate a unique hash code for the current item based on two randomly chosen unique prime numbers and all the object properties.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a unique integer hash code for this particular object
        See Also:
        http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27581/overriding-equals-and-hashcode-in-java, http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/javadocs/api-2.6/org/apache/commons/lang/builder/HashCodeBuilder.html, http://primes.utm.edu/lists/small/1000.txt
